def_en: A prize is money or something valuable that is given to someone who has the best results in a competition or game, or as a reward for doing good work.
You use prize to describe things that are of such good quality that they win prizes or deserve to win prizes.

def_cn: 非常珍贵的人（或物）；十分重要的人（或物）
def_en: You can refer to someone or something as a prize when people consider them to be of great value or importance.
Something that is prized is wanted and admired because it is considered to be very valuable or very good quality.
If you prize something open or prize it away from a surface, you force it to open or force it to come away from the surface.

def_cn: 竭力打探（消息等）；说服…透露（消息）
def_en: If you prize something such as information out of someone, you persuade them to tell you although they may be very unwilling to.
